newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber futures close flat in thin trade.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber futures close flat in thin trade.

text.p: Rubber futures finished virtually unchanged on Tuesday in sluggish trade with higher Japanese prices dragging down local sentiment, dealers said.
High stocks in Japan discouraged local buyers. Lower Japanese prices added to the gloom in the market, the traders said.
"It was very, very quiet. There was very little done. The market looked boring and dead," a local rubber trader said.
Tokyo's benchmark March contract settled at 135.3 against yesterday's 136.4 while Kobe's March contract finished at 135.4 from Monday's settlement of 136.2.
Dealers said they hope the market will become livelier ahead of the spot expiry in Japan on Friday.
At around 0945 GMT, December RSS3 was seen at 124.50-125.50 U.S. cents a kg from 125.5025 cents.
December RSS1 was seen at 177.00-178.00 Singapore cents (US$1.25-$1.26) a kg from the previous 178.25 cents.
December TSR20 was seen at 171.50-173.50 Singapore cents (US$1.22-$1.23) a kg against the previous 173.75 cents.
